intro: Eriocaulon mikawanum var. azumianum, commonly known as the Azumia sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. This variety is native to Japan and is typically found in wetland or marshy environments. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are often inconspicuous. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic habitats and supports local biodiversity.
